alert.note: Alert for Fountain; Parke; Tippecanoe; Vermillion; Warren (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 27 at 11:40AM EST until February 01 at 5:00AM EST by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for a portion of the following river in Indiana...Illinois... Wabash River, from Lafayette downstream to Riverton. .Lowland flooding continues along much of the Wabash River, from Lafayette down to Riverton. There is low potential for flooding to develop during the second half of the week of January 28 at Vincennes. The river is rising at all locations south of Lafayette. Flooding could be made worse by any ice jams that develop during ice break up, but this threat is diminishing due to the amount of time air temperatures are spending above the freezing mark. River levels on the White River at Elliston, Edwardsport, Petersburg, and Hazleton will be monitored for possible upcoming flood warnings. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Wabash River at Lafayette. * WHEN...Until early Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...At 17.0 feet, Lowland flooding in progress. Flood waters close SR 225 just south of the Wabash River near Battleground. Walking and bike trails in Tapawingo Park area are flooded. Warren CR 350 N in the Black Rock Preserve area flooded. Flood waters near Tippecanoe CR 950 W south of CR 75 S. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:30 AM EST Saturday the stage was 17.1 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:30 AM EST Saturday was 18.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 17.2 feet this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage Wednesday afternoon. - Flood stage is 11.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. Most flood related deaths occur in automobiles. Do not attempt to cross water covered bridges, dips, or low water crossings. Never try to cross a flowing stream, even a small one, on foot. To escape rising water find another route over higher ground. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind. The next statement should be issued late tonight by around 545 AM EST /445 AM CST/.
